00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *      File:   md_compiler.c
00050  *
00051  *      Description: The compiler for the IMPACT Meta-Description Language
00052  *
00053  *      Creation Date:  Feb. 1995
00054  *
00055  *      Authors: John C. Gyllenhaal and Wen-mei Hwu
00056  *
00057  *      Revisions:
00058  *
00059  *      John C. Gyllenhaal January 1998
00060  *           Implemented Marie Conte's and Andy Trick's suggestion of adding
00061  *           a new data type 'BLOCK' to allow an user to specify a block
00062  *           of binary data the same way ints, doubles, strings, and links
00063  *           are specified in fields.  (User readable input/output
00064  *           respresents this data as a hex string.  Note that this data type
00065  *           may not make sense to programs running on different platforms or
00066  *           compiled with different compilers!)
00067  *
00068 \*****************************************************************************/

00075 Mbuf *input_buf = NULL;
00076 
00077 char *program_name = NULL;
00078 
00079 /* Command line parameters */
00080 char *input_file_name = NULL;
00081 char *output_file_name = NULL;
00082 int using_stdin = 0;
00083 char *output_mode = NULL;
00084 char *input_mode = NULL;
00085 int output_page_width = 80;

00087 
00088 void
00089 print_usage (char *fmt, ...)
00090 {
00091   va_list args;
00092 
00093   /* Print out error message if fmt is not NULL */
00094   if (fmt != NULL)
00095     {
00096       fprintf (stderr, "\nError: ");
00097       va_start (args, fmt);
00098       vfprintf (stderr, fmt, args);
00099       va_end (args);
00100       fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00101     }
00102 
00103   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00104   fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s [options] [input_file]\n\n", program_name);
00105   fprintf (stderr, "options:\n");
00106   fprintf (stderr,
00107            "  -o output_file  outputs to output_file instead of to standard "
00108            "output. \n ");
00109   fprintf (stderr,
00110            "  -stdin          reads hmdes from standard input instead of "
00111            "input_file.\n");
00112   fprintf (stderr,
00113            "  -read_lmdes     reads as lmdes file instead of hmdes file.\n");
00114   fprintf (stderr,
00115            "  -names          output hmdes entry names instead of lmdes.\n");
00116   fprintf (stderr,
00117            "  -hmdes          output compiled hmdes instead of lmdes.\n");
00118   fprintf (stderr, "  -width int      sets page width for -hmdes output.\n");
00119   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00120   fprintf (stderr, "debug options:\n");
00121   fprintf (stderr,
00122            "  -bypass_alloc     use malloc instead of alloc routines.\n");
00123   fprintf (stderr, "  -print_usage      prints alloc routine stats.\n");
00124   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00125   exit (1);
00126 }
00127 
00128 void
00129 read_command_line_parameters (int argc, char **arg_ptr)
00130 {
00131   char *end_ptr;
00132   /* Get program name for error messages */
00133   program_name = strdup (*arg_ptr);
00134   /* Start parsing arguments at first argument */
00135   arg_ptr++;
00136   for (; *arg_ptr != NULL; arg_ptr++)
00137     {
00138       /* If first character is a '-', must be an option */
00139       if ((*arg_ptr)[0] == '-')
00140         {
00141           /* Get output file */
00142           if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-o") == 0)
00143             {
00144               /* Make sure -o not specified twice */
00145               if (output_file_name != NULL)
00146                 {
00147                   print_usage ("-o option specified twice.");
00148                 }
00149 
00150               /* Get output file name, expect it to be non-NULL */
00151               arg_ptr++;
00152               if (*arg_ptr == NULL)
00153                 {
00154                   print_usage ("expected '-o output_file'.\n");
00155                 }
00156               output_file_name = strdup (*arg_ptr);
00157             }
00158 
00159           /* Get -stdin flag */
00160           else if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-stdin") == 0)
00161             {
00162               using_stdin = 1;
00163             }
00164 
00165           /* Get -names or -hmdes flag */
00166           else
00167             if ((strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-names") == 0) ||
00168                 (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-hmdes") == 0))
00169             {
00170               /* Make sure some other output mode specified */
00171               if (output_mode != NULL)
00172                 print_usage ("output mode specified twice '%s' and '%s'.",
00173                              output_mode, *arg_ptr);
00174               output_mode = strdup (*arg_ptr);
00175             }
00176 
00177           /* Get -read_lmdes flag */
00178           else if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-read_lmdes") == 0)
00179             {
00180               /* Make sure some other input mode not specified */
00181               if (input_mode != NULL)
00182                 print_usage ("input mode specified twice '%s' and '%s'.",
00183                              input_mode, *arg_ptr);
00184               input_mode = strdup (*arg_ptr);
00185             }
00186 
00187           /* Get -width n flag */
00188           else if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-width") == 0)
00189             {
00190               /* Get width argument, expect it to be non-NULL */
00191               arg_ptr++;
00192               if (*arg_ptr == NULL)
00193                 {
00194                   print_usage ("expected '-width int'.\n");
00195                 }
00196 
00197               output_page_width = (int) strtol (*arg_ptr, &end_ptr, 10);
00198               if (*end_ptr != 0)
00199                 {
00200                   print_usage ("expected '-width int'.\n");
00201                 }
00202             }
00203 
00204           /* Get -bypass_alloc flag */
00205           else if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-bypass_alloc") == 0)
00206             {
00207               bypass_alloc_routines = 1;
00208             }
00209 
00210           else
00211             {
00212               print_usage ("unknown command line option '%s'.\n", *arg_ptr);
00213             }
00214         }
00215 
00216       /* Otherwise, must be file name (can only be one of command line) */
00217       else
00218         {
00219           if (input_file_name != NULL)
00220             {
00221               print_usage ("only one input file may be specified.\n");
00222             }
00223 
00224           /* Get input file name */
00225           input_file_name = strdup (*arg_ptr);
00226         }
00227     }
00228 
00229   /* Make sure input file has been specified */
00230   if ((input_file_name == NULL) && !using_stdin)
00231     {
00232       /* Print error only if they specified something */
00233       if (argc > 1)
00234         {
00235           print_usage ("input_file or -stdin must be specified.\n");
00236         }
00237       else
00238         {
00239           print_usage (NULL);
00240         }
00241     }
00242 
00243   /* Make sure input_file and -stdin have not both been specified */
00244   if ((input_file_name != NULL) && using_stdin)
00245     {
00246       print_usage ("may not specify both input_file and -stdin.\n");
00247     }
00248 
00249   /* Make sure input and output file are not the same */
00250   if ((input_file_name != NULL) && (output_file_name != NULL) &&
00251       (strcmp (input_file_name, output_file_name) == 0))
00252     {
00253       print_usage
00254         ("may not specify input file (%s) that is the same as output file.",
00255          input_file_name);}
00256 
00257 }
00258 
00259 int
00260 main (int argc, char **argv)
00261 {
00262   FILE *in;
00263   FILE *out;
00264   MD *md = NULL;
00265   /* Read command line arguments and input file name */
00266   read_command_line_parameters (argc, argv);
00267   /* Open input file */
00268   if (using_stdin)
00269     {
00270       input_file_name = strdup ("(stdin)");
00271       in = stdin;
00272     }
00273   else
00274     {
00275       if ((in = fopen (input_file_name, "r")) == NULL)
00276         L_punt ("Unable to open input file '%s'.", input_file_name);
00277     }
00278 
00279   /* Open output file */
00280   if (output_file_name == NULL)
00281     {
00282       output_file_name = strdup ("(stdout)");
00283       out = stdout;
00284     }
00285   else
00286     {
00287       if ((out = fopen (output_file_name, "w")) == NULL)
00288         L_punt ("Unable to open output file '%s'.", output_file_name);
00289     }
00290 
00291   /* Create global memory buffers */
00292   input_buf = create_Mbuf ();
00293   if (input_mode == NULL)
00294     {
00295       md = build_md (in, input_file_name);
00296     }
00297   else if (strcmp (input_mode, "-read_lmdes") == 0)
00298     {
00299       md = MD_read_md (in, input_file_name);
00300     }
00301   else
00302     {
00303       L_punt ("Unknown input mode '%s'.", input_mode);
00304     }
00305 
00306   /* Print out hmdes in form desired */
00307   if (output_mode == NULL)
00308     {
00309       MD_write_md (out, md);
00310     }
00311   else if (strcmp (output_mode, "-hmdes") == 0)
00312     {
00313       /* Print out section and entry declarations so, combined with the
00314        * output of MD_print_md, the output will be a legal hmdes file.
00315        */
00316       MD_print_md_declarations (out, md, 80);
00317       /* Put blank line after declarations */
00318       putc ('\n', out);
00319       /* Print out field declations and entry contents for each section */
00320       MD_print_md (out, md, 80);
00321     }
00322   else if (strcmp (output_mode, "-names") == 0)
00323     {
00324       MD_print_md_template (out, md);
00325     }
00326   else
00327     {
00328       L_punt ("Unknown output mode '%s'.", output_mode);
00329     }
00330 
00331   /* Free output mode */
00332   if (output_mode != NULL)
00333     free (output_mode);
00334   /* Free global memory buffers */
00335   free_Mbuf (input_buf);
00336   /* Free the database */
00337   MD_delete_md (md);
00338   /* Free library pools so we can be sure we freed everything */
00339   if (Mfile_pool != NULL)
00340     L_free_alloc_pool (Mfile_pool);
00341   if (Mline_pool != NULL)
00342     L_free_alloc_pool (Mline_pool);
00343   if (Mbuf_pool != NULL)
00344     L_free_alloc_pool (Mbuf_pool);
00345   if (Mptr_pool != NULL)
00346     L_free_alloc_pool (Mptr_pool);
00347   /* Close input and output (may be stdin/stdout) */
00348   fclose (in);
00349   fclose (out);
00350   return (0);
00351 }
00352 
00353 /* Create Fptr using Mfile library routines.
00354  * Adds checkpoint support and, in the future,
00355  * indication of what "source file" the line
00356  * being parsed is from 
00357  */
00358 Fptr *
00359 create_Fptr (Mfile * mfile)
00360 {
00361   Fptr *fptr;
00362   if ((fptr = (Fptr *) malloc (sizeof (Fptr))) == NULL)
00363     L_punt ("Out of memory");
00364   fptr->mptr = create_Mptr (mfile);
00365   fptr->checkpoint = copy_Mptr (fptr->mptr);
00366   fptr->source_name = create_Mbuf ();
00367   fptr->source_line = 1;
00368   return (fptr);
00369 }
00370 
00371 /* Frees Fptr */
00372 void
00373 free_Fptr (Fptr * fptr)
00374 {
00375   free_Mptr (fptr->mptr);
00376   free_Mptr (fptr->checkpoint);
00377   free_Mbuf (fptr->source_name);
00378   free (fptr);
00379 }
00380 
00381 /*
00382  * Fptr error handler, enhancement of Merror handler.
00383  * First argument is a Fptr in use when error occured 
00384  * (fptr->checkpoint points to start of token that caused error).
00385  * The second argument is a printf format string, and the rest
00386  * are the arguments for the format string.
00387  *
00388  * variable argument front end to vFerror().
00389  */
00390 void
00391 Ferror (Fptr * fptr, char *fmt, ...)
00392 {
00393   va_list args;
00394   va_start (args, fmt);
00395   vFerror (fptr, fmt, args);
00396   va_end (args);
00397 }
00398 
00399 void
00400 vFerror (Fptr * fptr, char *fmt, va_list args)
00401 {
00402   Mptr *checkpoint;
00403   /* Get checkpoint for ease of use */
00404   checkpoint = fptr->checkpoint;
00405   /*
00406    * Print out text line of text where error occured and put arrow to
00407    * location.  (pos starts at 0, so add 1 to get column)
00408    */
00409   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00410   /* If have preprocessor line directives in it, 
00411    * print out where error came from in original file.
00412    */
00413   if (len_of_Mbuf (fptr->source_name) != 0)
00414     {
00415       fprintf (stderr,
00416                "Error during parsing of md input file (line %i of %s):\n",
00417                fptr->source_line, get_Mbuf_buf (fptr->source_name));
00418     }
00419 
00420   /* If no preprocessor line directives and not at EOF */
00421   else if (checkpoint->mline != NULL)
00422     {
00423       fprintf (stderr,
00424                "Error during parsing of md input file (line %i char %i "
00425                "of %s):\n",
00426                checkpoint->mline->line_no,
00427                checkpoint->pos + 1, checkpoint->mfile->name);}
00428   /* If no preprocessor line directives and at EOF */
00429   else
00430     {
00431       fprintf (stderr,
00432                "Error during parsing of md input file (%s at EOF):\n",
00433                checkpoint->mfile->name);}
00434 
00435   /*Print error message */
00436   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, args);
00437   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00438   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00439   /* Do not print out file text if at EOF */
00440   if (checkpoint->mline != NULL)
00441     {
00442       /* Print out file text where error occurred */
00443       /* If have preprocessor line info,
00444        * print out where it occurred in preprocessed text
00445        */
00446       if (len_of_Mbuf (fptr->source_name) != 0)
00447         {
00448           fprintf (stderr,
00449                    "Text where error occurred (preprocessed: line %i char %i "
00450                    "of %s):\n",
00451                    checkpoint->mline->line_no,
00452                    checkpoint->pos + 1, checkpoint->mfile->name);}
00453       /* If don't have preprocessor line info */
00454       else
00455         {
00456           fprintf (stderr, "File text where error occurred:\n");
00457         }
00458       print_buf_with_arrow (stderr, checkpoint->mline->buf, checkpoint->pos);
00459     }
00460 
00461   fprintf (stderr, "Fatal error, cannot continue.\n");
00462   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00463   exit (-1);
00464 }
00465 
00466 
00467 /* Peeks at next character in file */
00468 int
00469 Fpeekc (Fptr * fptr)
00470 {
00471   int ch;
00472   ch = Mpeekc (fptr->mptr);
00473   return (ch);
00474 }
00475 
00476 /* Gets the next character in file */
00477 int
00478 Fgetc (Fptr * fptr)
00479 {
00480   int ch;
00481   ch = Mgetc (fptr->mptr);
00482   return (ch);
00483 }
00484 
00485 /* Reads line directive in from file and updates fptr state */
00486 void
00487 Fget_line_directive (Fptr * fptr)
00488 {
00489   int ch;
00490   int set_line, set_file;
00491   /* Reset flags to indicate what we read in */
00492   set_line = 0;
00493   set_file = 0;
00494   /* Move checkpoint to start of this processor line statement */
00495   move_Mptr (fptr->checkpoint, fptr->mptr);
00496   /* Sanity check, should be called with '$' in current possition */
00497   if (Fpeekc (fptr) != '$')
00498     Ferror (fptr, "Fget_line_directive() called at improper time.");
00499   /* Get '$' at start of line */
00500   Fgetc (fptr);
00501   /* Make sure '$' followed by 'line' */
00502   if ((Fgetc (fptr) != 'l') ||
00503       (Fgetc (fptr) != 'i') || (Fgetc (fptr) != 'n') || (Fgetc (fptr) != 'e'))
00504     {
00505       Ferror (fptr,
00506               "Unknown preprocessor directive.\nExpecting preprocessor line "
00507               "directive '$line line_no file_name'.");
00508     }
00509 
00510 
00511   /* In preprocessor statement.
00512    * Expect one of the following:
00513    * 1) $line line_no
00514    * 2) $line "file_name"
00515    * 3) $line line_no "file_name"
00516    */
00517 
00518   /* Skip spaces line number (' ' only ) */
00519   while (Fpeekc (fptr) == ' ')
00520     Fgetc (fptr);
00521   /* Get line number (if it is there) */
00522   ch = Fpeekc (fptr);
00523   if (isdigit (ch))
00524     {
00525       /* Build line number, one digit at a time */
00526       fptr->source_line = 0;
00527       /* Flag that we are setting the line number */
00528       set_line = 1;
00529       while (isdigit (ch))
00530         {
00531           /* Get the digit */
00532           ch = Fgetc (fptr);
00533           /* Multiply existing conversion by 10 and add digit */
00534           fptr->source_line *= 10;
00535           fptr->source_line += (ch - '0');
00536           /* Peek at next character */
00537           ch = Fpeekc (fptr);
00538         }
00539     }
00540 
00541   /* Skip spaces before file name (' ' only ) */
00542   while (Fpeekc (fptr) == ' ')
00543     Fgetc (fptr);
00544   /* Get file name (if it is there) */
00545   ch = Fpeekc (fptr);
00546   if (ch == '"')
00547     {
00548       /* Move checkpoint to start quote */
00549       move_Mptr (fptr->checkpoint, fptr->mptr);
00550       /* Get start quote */
00551       Fgetc (fptr);
00552       /* Flag that we are setting the file name */
00553       set_file = 1;
00554       /* Clear source name mbuf */
00555       clear_Mbuf (fptr->source_name);
00556       /* Read in name into source_name  until ending quote */
00557       while ((ch = Fgetc (fptr)) != '"')
00558         {
00559           /* If hit end of line or EOF, error */
00560           if ((ch == '\n') || (ch == EOF))
00561             {
00562               Ferror (fptr,
00563                       "Matching end quote expected in preprocessor line "
00564                       "directive.");
00565             }
00566 
00567           /* Add character to source name */
00568           addc_to_Mbuf (fptr->source_name, ch);
00569         }
00570     }
00571 
00572   /* Skip spaces before newline (' ' only ) */
00573   while (Fpeekc (fptr) == ' ')
00574     Fgetc (fptr);
00575   /* Expected newline now */
00576   ch = Fpeekc (fptr);
00577   if (((ch != '\n') && (ch != EOF)) || ((!set_line) && (!set_file)))
00578     {
00579       /* Move checkpoint to site of error */
00580       move_Mptr (fptr->checkpoint, fptr->mptr);
00581       Ferror (fptr,
00582               "Poorly formed preprocessor line directive.\n\nExpecting one of "
00583               "the following:\n 1) $line line_no\n 2) $line \"file_name\"\n "
00584               "3) or $line line_no \"file_name\".\n\nDirective must be "
00585               "terminated with a newline.");
00586     }
00587   /* Get newline */
00588   Fgetc (fptr);
00589 }
00590 
00591 
00592 /* Skips whitespace between tokens and updates the checkpoint used for
00593  * error messages.
00594  * Use before reading in EVERY token.
00595  * In future, will help keep trace of $line commands (source line info).
00596  */
00597 void
00598 Fadvance_to_next_token (Fptr * fptr)
00599 {
00600   int ch;
00601   while (1)
00602     {
00603       ch = Fpeekc (fptr);
00604       /* Detect line directive ('$' at begining of line ) */
00605       if ((ch == '$') && (Mptr_pos (fptr->mptr) == 0))
00606         {
00607           /* Read in line directive and start whitespace search again */
00608           Fget_line_directive (fptr);
00609           continue;
00610         }
00611 
00612       if (!isspace (ch))
00613         break;
00614       /* Throw away space */
00615       ch = Fgetc (fptr);
00616       /* After newlines, advance the source line count */
00617       if (ch == '\n')
00618         {
00619           fptr->source_line++;
00620         }
00621     }
00622 
00623   /* Move checkpoint to start of this token */
00624   move_Mptr (fptr->checkpoint, fptr->mptr);
00625 }
00626 
00627 /* Returns 1 if character is a single character token (I.e., a bracket) */
00628 int
00629 Fis_token_char (int ch)
00630 {
00631   switch (ch)
00632     {
00633     case '{':
00634     case '}':
00635     case '[':
00636     case ']':
00637     case '(':
00638     case ')':
00639     case '<':
00640     case '>':
00641     case ';':
00642     case '*':
00643     case '!':
00644     case '|':                   /* Special case, will grab '||' if there */
00645       return (1);
00646     }
00647   return (0);
00648 }
00649 
00650 
00651 /* Gets the next token from the fptr and puts it in the mbuf.
00652  * On EOF, the empty string will be put in mbuf.
00653  * Returns token length (0 on EOF).
00654  */
00655 int
00656 Fget_token (Fptr * fptr, Mbuf * mbuf)
00657 {
00658   int length;
00659   int ch;
00660   int quoted_string;
00661   int quote_ch = 0;
00662   /* Skip whitespace and set checkpoint to start of new token */
00663   Fadvance_to_next_token (fptr);
00664   /* Clear the mbuf */
00665   clear_Mbuf (mbuf);
00666   /* Is first character a token by itself? EOF? */
00667   if ((ch = Fpeekc (fptr)) == EOF)
00668     return (0);
00669   if (Fis_token_char (ch))
00670     {
00671       ch = Fgetc (fptr);
00672       addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, ch);
00673       /* Special case to generate '||' token */
00674       if (ch == '|')
00675         {
00676           if (Fpeekc (fptr) == '|')
00677             {
00678               ch = Fgetc (fptr);
00679               addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, ch);
00680               return (2);
00681             }
00682         }
00683 
00684       return (1);
00685     }
00686 
00687   /* Assume we don't have quoted string */
00688   quoted_string = 0;
00689   length = 0;
00690   /* Handle start of quoted string */
00691   if ((ch == '"') || (ch == '\''))
00692     {
00693       /* Get the end quote character we are looking for */
00694       quote_ch = ch;
00695       /* Get the quote and put it in Mbuf */
00696       ch = Fgetc (fptr);
00697       addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, ch);
00698       /* Mark as quoted string */
00699       quoted_string = 1;
00700       length++;
00701     }
00702 
00703 
00704   /* Otherwise, get token until hit whitespace or single char token */
00705   while ((ch = Fpeekc (fptr)) != EOF)
00706     {
00707       /* For quoted strings, don't end token until end quote */
00708       if (quoted_string)
00709         {
00710           /* If hit end quote, finish string and return */
00711           if (ch == quote_ch)
00712             {
00713               ch = Fgetc (fptr);
00714               addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, ch);
00715               length++;
00716               break;
00717             }
00718 
00719           /* Error if hit end of line before end quote */
00720           if (ch == '\n')
00721             {
00722               Ferror (fptr,
00723                       "End quote not found.  Expected before the end of this "
00724                       "line.");
00725             }
00726         }
00727 
00728       /* For unquoted strings, stop at whitespace or single char token.
00729        * Quotes are not allowed in the middle of the unquoted string
00730        */
00731       else
00732         {
00733           if (isspace (ch) || Fis_token_char (ch))
00734             break;
00735           if ((ch == '\'') || (ch == '"'))
00736             {
00737               /* Move error pointer to current location */
00738               Fadvance_to_next_token (fptr);
00739               Ferror (fptr,
00740                       "Unexpected quote.  Expecting one of the following:\n "
00741                       "1) Whitespace or some sort of delimiter before the "
00742                       "quote\n 2) or a backslash before the quote.");
00743             }
00744         }
00745 
00746       /* Get character and add to mbuf */
00747       ch = Fgetc (fptr);
00748       addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, ch);
00749       /* Increment length */
00750       length++;
00751       /* Handle backslashed character */
00752       if (ch == '\\')
00753         {
00754           ch = Fgetc (fptr);
00755           /* May not be newline or EOF after backslash */
00756           if ((ch == '\n') || (ch == EOF))
00757             {
00758               Ferror (fptr,
00759                       "A backslash may not appear at the end of a line.");}
00760           addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, ch);
00761           length++;
00762         }
00763     }
00764 
00765   /* Return the length of multichar token */
00766   return (length);
00767 }
00768 
00769 /* Returns 1 if a legal identifier (C identifier), 0 otherwise */
00770 int
00771 is_md_ident (char *ident)
00772 {
00773   char *ptr;
00774   /* Must start with letter of '_' (may not be empty string) */
00775   if ((ident[0] != '_') && !isalpha (ident[0]))
00776     return (0);
00777   /* Rest of string must be alphnumeric or '_' */
00778   for (ptr = &ident[1]; *ptr != 0; ptr++)
00779     {
00780       if ((*ptr != '_') && !isalnum (*ptr))
00781         return (0);
00782     }
00783 
00784   /* Return legal */
00785   return (1);
00786 }
00787 
00788 MD *
00789 build_md (FILE * in, char *md_name)
00790 {
00791   MD *md;
00792   MD_Section *section;
00793   Mfile *input_mfile;
00794   Mbuf *mbuf;
00795   Fptr *fptr;
00796   char *section_name;
00797   int new_section = 0;
00798   int error_count;
00799   /* Load file into Mfile so can create Fptr */
00800   input_mfile = create_Mfile (in, md_name, "MD building");
00801   /* Create Fptr so we can parse file */
00802   fptr = create_Fptr (input_mfile);
00803   /* Create Mbuf to put tokens into */
00804   mbuf = create_Mbuf ();
00805   /* Create a md with the given input file name (start with 0 sections). */
00806   md = MD_new_md (md_name, 0);
00807   /* Parse all the sections in the file */
00808   while (Fget_token (fptr, mbuf))
00809     {
00810       /* 
00811        * Get pointer to new or existing section
00812        */
00813 
00814       /* Test for creation of a new section */
00815       if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "CREATE"))
00816         {
00817           /* "CREATE" must be followed by "SECTION" */
00818           Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
00819           if (!match_Mbuf (mbuf, "SECTION"))
00820             Ferror (fptr, "Expecting 'SECTION' after 'CREATE'.");
00821           /* Mark that this is a new section */
00822           new_section = 1;
00823         }
00824 
00825       /* Test for referencing of existing section */
00826       else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "SECTION"))
00827         {
00828           /* Mark that this is an existing section */
00829           new_section = 0;
00830         }
00831 
00832       else
00833         {
00834           Ferror (fptr, "Expecting 'SECTION' or 'CREATE SECTION' keyword.");
00835         }
00836 
00837       /* Get section name */
00838       if (!Fget_token (fptr, mbuf))
00839         Ferror (fptr, "Expecting a section name after 'SECTION'.");
00840       /* Create new section or get existing sectino */
00841       section_name = copy_Mbuf_buf (mbuf);
00842       /* Make sure legal section name */
00843       if (!is_md_ident (section_name))
00844         {
00845           Ferror (fptr, "Invalid section name.  Must be valid C identifier.");
00846         }
00847 
00848       if (new_section)
00849         {
00850           /* Make sure this section does not already exist */
00851           if (MD_find_section (md, section_name) != NULL)
00852             Ferror (fptr, "Section '%s' already exists!", section_name);
00853           /* Create a new sections, start with no assumption about size */
00854           section = MD_new_section (md, section_name, 0, 0);
00855         }
00856       else
00857         {
00858           /* Find the the section */
00859           if ((section = MD_find_section (md, section_name)) == NULL)
00860             {
00861               Ferror (fptr,
00862                       "Section '%s' undefined.  Fix spelling or use 'CREATE "
00863                       "SECTION'.",
00864                       section_name);}
00865         }
00866 
00867       /*
00868        * Get field declarations until hit section start marker.
00869        */
00870       while (1)
00871         {
00872           Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
00873           /* Hit section start marker, exit loop */
00874           if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, SECTION_START))
00875             break;
00876           /* Create field using declaration.
00877            * Field_Decl type passed in mbuf (contents destroyed after call)
00878            * and fptr advances to after declaration.
00879            */
00880           build_field_decl (md, section, fptr, mbuf);
00881           /*
00882              create_Field_Decl (md, section, fptr, mbuf);
00883            */
00884         }
00885 
00886 
00887       /*
00888        * Get section entries until hit section end marker.
00889        */
00890       while (1)
00891         {
00892           Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
00893           /* Get section end marker */
00894           if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, SECTION_END))
00895             break;
00896           /* Create section entry.
00897            * Entry name passed in mbuf (contents destroyed after call) and
00898            * ftpr advances to after entry.
00899            */
00900           build_entry (section, fptr, mbuf);
00901           /*
00902              create_Entry (md, section, fptr, mbuf);
00903            */
00904         }
00905 
00906       /* Finished with reading in section, free temp variables */
00907       free (section_name);
00908     }
00909 
00910   /* Check the md for required links (there should not be other errors). */
00911   error_count = MD_check_md (stderr, md);
00912   if (error_count)
00913     {
00914       fprintf (stderr, "\nError: All required fields must be specified!\n\n");
00915       L_punt ("Cannot continue: %i unspecified fields in '%s'.",
00916               error_count, md->name);}
00917 
00918   /* Check the md for ambigous links */
00919   error_count = check_md_for_ambiguous_links (stderr, md);
00920   if (error_count)
00921     {
00922       fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00923       L_punt ("Cannot continue: %i ambiguous links detected in '%s'.",
00924               error_count, md->name);
00925     }
00926 
00927   /* Free Fptr, Mfile, and Mbuf */
00928   free_Fptr (fptr);
00929   free_Mfile (input_mfile);
00930   free_Mbuf (mbuf);
00931   return (md);
00932 }
00933 
00934 /* Create a field in the section using the field declaration starting
00935  * in the mbuf and pointed to by fptr.
00936  *
00937  * Destroys contents of mbuf and advances fptr to after declaration.
00938  */
00939 void
00940 build_field_decl (MD * md, MD_Section * section, Fptr * fptr, Mbuf * mbuf)
00941 {
00942   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
00943   MD_FIELD_TYPE field_type = 0;
00944   MD_Section **target_array, *target, **new_target_array;
00945   char *field_type_name, *field_name, *target_name;
00946   int target_count, target_array_size, new_target_array_size, i;
00947   /* Optional field declaration */
00948   if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "OPTIONAL"))
00949     field_type = MD_OPTIONAL_FIELD;
00950   /* Required field declaration */
00951   else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "REQUIRED"))
00952     field_type = MD_REQUIRED_FIELD;
00953 #if 0
00954   /* Ignored field declaration */
00955   else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "IGNORED"))
00956     field_type = IGNORED_FIELD;
00957 #endif
00958   /* Otherwise, parse error */
00959   else
00960     {
00961       Ferror (fptr,
00962               "Expecting start of section delimiter '%s' or\ndeclaration of "
00963               "field type 'OPTIONAL', 'REQUIRED', or 'IGNORED'.",
00964               SECTION_START);}
00965 
00966   /* Get type name for error messages */
00967   field_type_name = copy_Mbuf_buf (mbuf);
00968   /* Get field name */
00969   if (!Fget_token (fptr, mbuf))
00970     Ferror (fptr, "Expecting a field name after '%s'.", field_type_name);
00971   field_name = copy_Mbuf_buf (mbuf);
00972   /* Make sure legal field name */
00973   if (!is_md_ident (field_name))
00974     {
00975       Ferror (fptr,
00976               "Invalid field name in declaration.  Must be valid C "
00977               "identifier.");
00978     }
00979 
00980   /* For now, do not allow field names to be redeclared */
00981   if ((field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (section, field_name)) != NULL)
00982     {
00983       Ferror (fptr, "Redeclaration of a field is not allowed.");
00984     }
00985 
00986   /* Declare a new field */
00987   field_decl = MD_new_field_decl (section, field_name, field_type);
00988   /* Get field_decl start delimiter */
00989   Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
00990   if (!match_Mbuf (mbuf, FIELD_START))
00991     Ferror (fptr,
00992             "Expecting '%s' after field name '%s' in declaration.",
00993             FIELD_START, field_name);
00994   /* Get the element requirements for the field until hit end of 
00995    * field marker 
00996    */
00997   while (1)
00998     {
00999       Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01000       /* Detect end of field declaration */
01001       if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, FIELD_END))
01002         break;
01003       /* Detect Kleene star on last element requirement */
01004       if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, KLEENE_STAR))
01005         {
01006           /* May not have a Kleen star by itself */
01007           if (field_decl->max_require_index == -1)
01008             {
01009               Ferror (fptr,
01010                       "Expecting element requirement before kleene star '%s'.",
01011                       KLEENE_STAR);}
01012 
01013           MD_kleene_star_requirement (field_decl,
01014                                       field_decl->max_require_index);
01015           /* Make sure end of field declaration is next */
01016           Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01017           /* If end of field declaration, exit loop, otherwise error */
01018           if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, FIELD_END))
01019             break;
01020           else
01021             {
01022               Ferror (fptr,
01023                       "A Kleene star '%s' is allowed only on the last element "
01024                       "requirement,\nexpecting '%s%s'.",
01025                       KLEENE_STAR, FIELD_END, TERMINATOR);
01026             }
01027 
01028           /* Break out of loop, hit end of declaration */
01029           break;
01030         }
01031 
01032       /* Get the type of element requirment we have. */
01033       if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "INT"))
01034         {
01035           MD_require_int (field_decl, field_decl->max_require_index + 1);
01036         }
01037 
01038       else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "DOUBLE"))
01039         {
01040           MD_require_double (field_decl, field_decl->max_require_index + 1);
01041         }
01042 
01043       else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "STRING"))
01044         {
01045           MD_require_string (field_decl, field_decl->max_require_index + 1);
01046         }
01047 
01048       else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "BLOCK"))
01049         {
01050           MD_require_block (field_decl, field_decl->max_require_index + 1);
01051         }
01052 
01053       else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, "LINK"))
01054         {
01055           /* Get the link start delimiter around section name */
01056           Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01057           if (!match_Mbuf (mbuf, LINK_START))
01058             {
01059               Ferror (fptr,
01060                       "Expecting 'LINK%ssection_name%s'.",
01061                       LINK_START, LINK_END);}
01062 
01063           /* Allocate a target array to hold pointers to the targets */
01064           target_array_size = 1;
01065           target_array = (MD_Section **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Section *) *
01066                                                  target_array_size);
01067           /* Initialize target count */
01068           target_count = 0;
01069           /* Get all the targets that we may link to */
01070           while (1)
01071             {
01072               /* Get the section name */
01073               Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01074               target_name = copy_Mbuf_buf (mbuf);
01075               if ((target = MD_find_section (md, target_name)) == NULL)
01076                 {
01077                   Ferror (fptr,
01078                           "Cannot create LINK, section '%s' not defined.",
01079                           target_name);}
01080 
01081               /* Make sure this target not already in LINK */
01082               for (i = 0; i < target_count; i++)
01083                 {
01084                   if (target_array[i] == target)
01085                     {
01086                       Ferror (fptr, "Section '%s' already in LINK.",
01087                               target_name);}
01088                 }
01089 
01090               /* Add target to target array */
01091               /* Determine if target array need increasing */
01092               if (target_count >= target_array_size)
01093                 {
01094                   /* Double target array size */
01095                   new_target_array_size = target_array_size << 1;
01096                   /* Malloc new array */
01097                   new_target_array =
01098                     (MD_Section **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Section **) *
01099                                             new_target_array_size);
01100                   /* Copy over pointers from old array */
01101                   for (i = 0; i < target_count; i++)
01102                     new_target_array[i] = target_array[i];
01103                   /* Free old array and put new one in it's place */
01104                   free (target_array);
01105                   target_array = new_target_array;
01106                   target_array_size = new_target_array_size;
01107                 }
01108 
01109               /* Add to target array */
01110               target_array[target_count] = target;
01111               /* Increment target count */
01112               target_count++;
01113               /* Get the link end delimiter around section name or
01114                * the OR_MARKER for another section name 
01115                */
01116               Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01117               /* Free malloced target_name */
01118               free (target_name);
01119               target_name = NULL;
01120               /* Get end of declaration */
01121               if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, LINK_END))
01122                 {
01123                   break;
01124                 }
01125               /* Or get OR marker (get next target */
01126               else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, OR_MARKER))
01127                 {
01128                   continue;
01129                 }
01130               else
01131                 {
01132                   Ferror (fptr,
01133                           "Expecting one of the following:\n 1) End of LINK "
01134                           "delimiter '%s'\n 2) or '%' followed by another "
01135                           "section name.", LINK_END, OR_MARKER);
01136                 }
01137             }
01138 
01139           /* Create link requirement (Use multi target form) */
01140           MD_require_multi_target_link (field_decl,
01141                                         field_decl->max_require_index + 1,
01142                                         target_count, target_array);
01143           /* Free target array */
01144           free (target_array);
01145         }
01146 
01147       else
01148         {
01149           Ferror (fptr,
01150                   "Expecting one of the following:\n 1) a element requirement "
01151                   "of 'INT', 'DOUBLE', 'STRING',\n    'BLOCK', or "
01152                   "'LINK%ssection_name%s'\n 2) a Kleene star '%s' "
01153                   "(allowed only on the last element requirement)\n 3) or a "
01154                   "end of declaration delimiter '%s%s' for field '%s'.",
01155                   LINK_START, LINK_END,
01156                   KLEENE_STAR, FIELD_END, TERMINATOR, field_name);}
01157     }
01158 
01159   /* Get terminator at end of field declaration */
01160   Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01161   if (!match_Mbuf (mbuf, TERMINATOR))
01162     {
01163       Ferror (fptr,
01164               "Expecting '%s%s' at end of declaration of field '%s'.",
01165               FIELD_END, TERMINATOR, field_name);
01166     }
01167 
01168   /* Free field type name and field name, for error messages only. */
01169   free (field_name);
01170   free (field_type_name);
01171 }
01172 
01173 /* Returns 1 if valid md int.  Return int in value */
01174 int
01175 build_int (char *string, int *value)
01176 {
01177   char *end_ptr, *ptr;
01178   /* Require the int to have at least 1 digit in it */
01179   for (ptr = string; *ptr != 0; ptr++)
01180     {
01181       if (isdigit (*ptr))
01182         break;
01183     }
01184   if (*ptr == 0)
01185     return (0);
01186   /* Convert to long, make sure
01187    * conversion goes to end of string.
01188    */
01189   *value = (int) strtol (string, &end_ptr, 0);
01190   if (*end_ptr != 0)
01191     return (0);
01192   /* If got here, must be legel int */
01193   return (1);
01194 }
01195 
01196 /* Returns 1 if valid double value.  Returns double in value */
01197 int
01198 build_double (char *string, double *value)
01199 {
01200   char *end_ptr, *ptr;
01201   /* Require the float to have at least 1 digit in it */
01202   for (ptr = string; *ptr != 0; ptr++)
01203     {
01204       if (isdigit (*ptr))
01205         break;
01206     }
01207   if (*ptr == 0)
01208     return (0);
01209   /* Convert to double, make sure
01210    * conversion goes to end of string.
01211    */
01212   *value = strtod (string, &end_ptr);
01213   if (*end_ptr != 0)
01214     return (0);
01215   /* If got here, must be legel double */
01216   return (1);
01217 }
01218 
01219 /* Strips first and last character from string (modifies string) */
01220 void
01221 strip_first_and_last_char (char *string)
01222 {
01223   char *ptr;
01224   /* If empty string, do nothing */
01225   if (string[0] == 0)
01226     return;
01227   /* If 1 character long string, make empty string */
01228   if (string[1] == 0)
01229     {
01230       string[0] = 0;
01231       return;
01232     }
01233 
01234   /* Shift string one character to left, 
01235    * stop before copying last character
01236    */
01237   for (ptr = string; *(ptr + 2) != 0; ptr++)
01238     *ptr = *(ptr + 1);
01239   /* Terminate string */
01240   *ptr = 0;
01241 }
01242 
01243 /*
01244  * Strips backslashes from brackslashed characters in string (modifies string)
01245  */
01246 void
01247 strip_backslashes (char *string)
01248 {
01249   char *src_ptr, *dest_ptr;
01250   int ch;
01251   /* Get pointers to start of string */
01252   dest_ptr = string;
01253   src_ptr = string;
01254   /* Copy string to itself, removing backslashes from backslashed
01255    * characters.
01256    */
01257   while (1)
01258     {
01259       /* Get next character from string */
01260       ch = *src_ptr;
01261       /* If backslash, skip and get next character */
01262       if (ch == '\\')
01263         {
01264           src_ptr++;
01265           ch = *src_ptr;
01266         }
01267 
01268       /* Write character back to string */
01269       *dest_ptr = ch;
01270       /* Stop after copying terminator */
01271       if (ch == 0)
01272         break;
01273       /* Goto next character for processing */
01274       dest_ptr++;
01275       src_ptr++;
01276     }
01277 }
01278 
01279 
01280 void
01281 build_element (MD_Field * field, MD_Element_Req * element_req,
01282                int element_index, Fptr * fptr, Mbuf * mbuf)
01283 {
01284   MD_Section **target_array;
01285   MD_Entry *entry, *target_entry;
01286   int int_value;
01287   double double_value;
01288   int target_count, i;
01289   char *element_string;
01290   unsigned int block_size, string_len;
01291   unsigned char *block_data, block_byte = '\0', high_hex_ch, low_hex_ch;
01292   /* Get the element's value string */
01293   element_string = copy_Mbuf_buf (mbuf);
01294   /* Check datum based on type */
01295   switch (element_req->type)
01296     {
01297     case MD_INT:
01298       if (!build_int (element_string, &int_value))
01299         {
01300           Ferror (fptr,
01301                   "Invalid element '%s'.\nElement has an '%s' requirement.",
01302                   element_string, element_req->desc);
01303         }
01304       MD_set_int (field, element_index, int_value);
01305       break;
01306     case MD_DOUBLE:
01307       if (!build_double (element_string, &double_value))
01308         {
01309           Ferror (fptr,
01310                   "Invalid element '%s'.\nElement has a '%s' requirement.",
01311                   element_string, element_req->desc);
01312         }
01313       MD_set_double (field, element_index, double_value);
01314       break;
01315       /* Anything can be a string */
01316     case MD_STRING:
01317       /* Strip quotes from string if present */
01318       if ((element_string[0] == '"') || (element_string[0] == '\''))
01319         strip_first_and_last_char (element_string);
01320       /* Unquoted string may not contain token characters (will
01321        * be put in first character of string if token character)
01322        */
01323       else if (Fis_token_char (element_string[0]))
01324         {
01325           Ferror (fptr,
01326                   "Unquoted strings may not contain a '%c', put quotes "
01327                   "around the string.",
01328                   element_string[0]);
01329         }
01330 
01331       /* Remove backslashes from backslashed characters */
01332       strip_backslashes (element_string);
01333       MD_set_string (field, element_index, element_string);
01334       break;
01335       /* Binary data blocks must be an even number of hex characters.
01336        * Quotes are optional.
01337        */
01338     case MD_BLOCK:
01339       /* Strip quotes from string if present */
01340       if ((element_string[0] == '"') || (element_string[0] == '\''))
01341         strip_first_and_last_char (element_string);
01342       /* Get length of string */
01343       string_len = strlen (element_string);
01344       /* String length must be even */
01345       if ((string_len & 1) == 1)
01346         {
01347           Ferror (fptr,
01348                   "BLOCK hex string length (%i) must be even!", string_len);}
01349 
01350       /* Set the block size to half of the string length */
01351       block_size = string_len >> 1;
01352       /* If block size is zero, don't malloc anything.  Everything
01353        * should work with NULL ptr and zero size.
01354        */
01355       if (block_size != 0)
01356         {
01357           /* Allocate binary block array (byte array) */
01358           if ((block_data = (unsigned char *) malloc (block_size)) == NULL)
01359             {
01360               L_punt ("Out of memory allocating BLOCK data of %i bytes.",
01361                       string_len >> 1);
01362             }
01363         }
01364       else
01365         {
01366           block_data = NULL;
01367         }
01368 
01369       /* Convert hex string into binary block data */
01370       for (i = 0; i < block_size; i++)
01371         {
01372           high_hex_ch = element_string[(i << 1)];
01373           if ((high_hex_ch >= '0') && (high_hex_ch <= '9'))
01374             block_byte = (high_hex_ch - '0') << 4;
01375           else if ((high_hex_ch >= 'a') && (high_hex_ch <= 'f'))
01376             block_byte = (high_hex_ch - 'a' + 10) << 4;
01377           else if ((high_hex_ch >= 'A') && (high_hex_ch <= 'F'))
01378             block_byte = (high_hex_ch - 'A' + 10) << 4;
01379           else
01380             {
01381               Ferror (fptr,
01382                       "Invalid hex character '%c' at position %i"
01383                       "in BLOCK hex string.", high_hex_ch, (i << 1) + 1);
01384             }
01385 
01386           low_hex_ch = element_string[(i << 1) + 1];
01387           if ((low_hex_ch >= '0') && (low_hex_ch <= '9'))
01388             block_byte |= (low_hex_ch - '0');
01389           else if ((low_hex_ch >= 'a') && (low_hex_ch <= 'f'))
01390             block_byte |= (low_hex_ch - 'a' + 10);
01391           else if ((low_hex_ch >= 'A') && (low_hex_ch <= 'F'))
01392             block_byte |= (low_hex_ch - 'A' + 10);
01393           else
01394             {
01395               Ferror (fptr,
01396                       "Invalid hex character '%c' at position %i"
01397                       "in BLOCK hex string.", low_hex_ch, (i << 1) + 2);
01398             }
01399 
01400           /* Write byte to block data array */
01401           block_data[i] = block_byte;
01402         }
01403 
01404       /* Set element to block data */
01405       MD_set_block (field, element_index, block_size, block_data);
01406       /* Free block_data buffer, if necessary */
01407       if (block_data != NULL)
01408         free (block_data);
01409       break;
01410     case MD_LINK:
01411       /* Strip quotes from entry name (if present) */
01412       if ((element_string[0] == '"') || (element_string[0] == '\''))
01413         strip_first_and_last_char (element_string);
01414       /* Remove backslashes from backslashed characters */
01415       strip_backslashes (element_string);
01416       /* Search target array for entry name.  It must be in exactly
01417        * one section.
01418        */
01419       target_array = element_req->link;
01420       target_count = element_req->link_array_size;
01421       entry = NULL;
01422       target_entry = NULL;
01423       for (i = 0; i < target_count; i++)
01424         {
01425           /* See if entry name appears in this section */
01426           entry = MD_find_entry (target_array[i], element_string);
01427           if (entry != NULL)
01428             {
01429               /* Error if multiple matches found */
01430               if (target_entry != NULL)
01431                 {
01432                   Ferror (fptr,
01433                           "%s->%s->%s[%i]:\nAmbiguous entry name '%s' for "
01434                           "element with requirement\n'%s'.\nEntry name found "
01435                           "in section '%s' and '%s'.",
01436                           field->entry->section->name, field->entry->name,
01437                           field->decl->name, element_index,
01438                           element_string, element_req->desc,
01439                           entry->section->name, target_entry->section->name);}
01440               target_entry = entry;
01441             }
01442         }
01443 
01444       /* Error if no matches found */
01445       if (target_entry == NULL)
01446         {
01447           Ferror (fptr,
01448                   "%s->%s->%s[%i]:\n  Entry name '%s' is not found in any "
01449                   "section specified by the\n  element requirement '%s'.",
01450                   field->entry->section->name, field->entry->name,
01451                   field->decl->name, element_index, element_string,
01452                   element_req->desc);}
01453 
01454       /* Set link to entry specified */
01455       MD_set_link (field, element_index, target_entry);
01456       break;
01457     default:
01458       Ferror (fptr, "Element requirement type %i not defined.",
01459               element_req->type);}
01460 
01461   /* Free element value */
01462   free (element_string);
01463 }
01464 
01465 
01466 /* Create a Entry in the section using the Entry description starting
01467  * in the mbuf and pointed to by fptr.
01468  *
01469  * Destroys contents of mbuf and advances fptr to after entry.
01470  */
01471 void
01472 build_entry (MD_Section * section, Fptr * fptr, Mbuf * mbuf)
01473 {
01474   MD_Entry *entry;
01475   char *entry_name, *stripped_entry_name = NULL;
01476   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
01477   MD_Field *field;
01478   MD_Element_Req **require_array, *element_req, *kleene_starred_req;
01479   char *field_name;
01480   int element_index, max_require_index;
01481   /* Get entry name */
01482   entry_name = copy_Mbuf_buf (mbuf);
01483   /* Make sure legal entry name (a valid C identifier or a quoted string).
01484    * If it is, get "stripped" name (without quotes)
01485    */
01486   if (is_md_ident (entry_name))
01487     {
01488       stripped_entry_name = strdup (entry_name);
01489     }
01490   else if ((entry_name[0] == '"') || (entry_name[0] == '\''))
01491     {
01492       stripped_entry_name = strdup (entry_name);
01493       strip_first_and_last_char (stripped_entry_name);
01494       /* Remove backslashes from backslashed characters */
01495       strip_backslashes (stripped_entry_name);
01496     }
01497   else
01498     {
01499       Ferror (fptr,
01500               "Expecting one of the following:\n 1) a entry name (must be a "
01501               "valid C identifier or a quoted string)\n 2) or a end of "
01502               "section delimiter '%s' for section '%s'.",
01503               SECTION_END, section->name);}
01504 
01505   /* Use existing entry if exists, otherwise create new entry
01506    * Use stripped entry name for search and table index.
01507    * Put actual name (with quotes, if any) in entry
01508    */
01509   if ((entry = MD_find_entry (section, stripped_entry_name)) == NULL)
01510     {
01511       entry = MD_new_entry (section, stripped_entry_name);
01512     }
01513 
01514   /* Get the ENTRY_START marker */
01515   Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01516   if (!match_Mbuf (mbuf, ENTRY_START))
01517     {
01518       Ferror (fptr,
01519               "Expecting start of entry marker '%s' after '%s'.",
01520               ENTRY_START, entry_name);}
01521 
01522   /* Get the entries fields until end of entry encountered */
01523   while (1)
01524     {
01525       Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01526       /* If end of entry marker, exit loop */
01527       if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, ENTRY_END))
01528         break;
01529       /* Assume it is a valid field name */
01530       field_name = copy_Mbuf_buf (mbuf);
01531       /* Get field if defined in section, error if not defined */
01532       if ((field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (section, field_name)) == NULL)
01533         {
01534           /* Assume mispelling if legal identifier */
01535           if (is_md_ident (field_name))
01536             {
01537               Ferror (fptr,
01538                       "Field '%s' undefined in section '%s'.\nFix spelling or "
01539                       "declare field at the top of this section.",
01540                       field_name, section->name);}
01541           /* Otherwise, syntax error */
01542           else
01543             {
01544               Ferror (fptr,
01545                       "Expecting one of the following:\n 1) a field name that "
01546                       "has been declared in section '%s'\n 2) or a end of "
01547                       "entry marker  '%s%s' for entry '%s'.",
01548                       section->name, ENTRY_END, TERMINATOR, entry_name);
01549             }
01550         }
01551 
01552       /* Set Field to NULL for debugging, get or create a field
01553        * depending on the next token 
01554        */
01555       field = NULL;
01556       /* Get replace field, concat field, or start field marker */
01557       Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01558       /* Check for concat field marker */
01559       if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, CONCAT_FIELD))
01560         {
01561           /* Error if field is not kleene_starred */
01562           if (field_decl->kleene_starred_req == NULL)
01563             {
01564               Ferror (fptr,
01565                       "Cannot concatenate to contents of field '%s',\n"
01566                       "last datum in declaration of field '%s' not "
01567                       "Kleene starred '%s'.",
01568                       field_name, field_name, KLEENE_STAR);}
01569 
01570           /* Find the field that we are concatenating, error if contents
01571            * have not already been set unless first datum is
01572            * kleene_starred
01573            */
01574           if ((field = MD_find_field (entry, field_decl)) == NULL)
01575             {
01576               /* Is first datum is Kleene starred (if there is only
01577                * one datum defined)?  If not, error.
01578                */
01579               if (field_decl->max_require_index >= 1)
01580                 {
01581                   Ferror (fptr,
01582                           "Cannot concatenate to contents of field '%s'.\n"
01583                           "Expect one of the following:\n 1) The contents of "
01584                           "field '%s' to be previously set for entry '%s'\n "
01585                           "2) or the first and ONLY datum declared for this "
01586                           "field to be Kleene starred.",
01587                           field_name, field_name, entry_name);
01588                 }
01589 
01590               else
01591                 {
01592                   /* Create new field to concat to */
01593                   field = MD_new_field (entry, field_decl, 0);
01594                 }
01595             }
01596 
01597           /* Get what should be the start field marker into mbuf */
01598           Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01599         }
01600 
01601       /* Replace field contents (if field already defined) */
01602       else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, REPLACE_FIELD))
01603         {
01604           if ((field = MD_find_field (entry, field_decl)) != NULL)
01605             {
01606               MD_delete_field (field);
01607             }
01608 
01609           /* Create field in place of field we just destroyed */
01610           field = MD_new_field (entry, field_decl, 0);
01611           /* Get what should be the start field marker into mbuf */
01612           Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01613         }
01614       else if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, FIELD_START))
01615         {
01616           /* Make sure the contents for this field has not already been set */
01617           if ((field = MD_find_field (entry, field_decl)) != NULL)
01618             {
01619               Ferror (fptr,
01620                       "Contents of field '%s' already set.\nUse '%s%s' to "
01621                       "concatenate to the end of the existing contents\nor "
01622                       "use '%s%s' to replace field's contents.",
01623                       field_name,
01624                       CONCAT_FIELD, FIELD_START, REPLACE_FIELD, FIELD_START);}
01625           /* Create field */
01626           field = MD_new_field (entry, field_decl, 0);
01627         }
01628 
01629       /* Must be a start field marker by now */
01630       if (!match_Mbuf (mbuf, FIELD_START))
01631         {
01632           Ferror (fptr,
01633                   "Expecting one of the following after the field name '%s':\n "
01634                   "1) a concat field contents marker '%s%s'\n 2) a replace "
01635                   "field contents marker '%s%s'\n 3) or a start field contents "
01636                   "marker '%s'.",
01637                   field_name,
01638                   CONCAT_FIELD, FIELD_START,
01639                   REPLACE_FIELD, FIELD_START, FIELD_START);}
01640 
01641       /* Add elements to end of field.  This will be the beginning of
01642        * the field except for CONCAT field operations.
01643        */
01644       element_index = field->max_element_index + 1;
01645       max_require_index = field_decl->max_require_index;
01646       require_array = field_decl->require;
01647       kleene_starred_req = field_decl->kleene_starred_req;
01648       while (1)
01649         {
01650           /* If element index falls with boundaries of require array
01651            * get that requirement
01652            */
01653           if (element_index <= max_require_index)
01654             element_req = require_array[element_index];
01655           /* Otherwise, get kleene star requirement (will be NULL if
01656            * there is no kleene star requirement.)
01657            */
01658           else
01659             element_req = kleene_starred_req;
01660           /* Get next datum, punt on EOF */
01661           if (!Fget_token (fptr, mbuf))
01662             {
01663               Ferror (fptr,
01664                       "%s->%s->%s:\n  Unexpected EOF encountered while "
01665                       "reading element %i.",
01666                       entry->section->name, entry->name,
01667                       field->decl->name, element_index);}
01668 
01669           /* Stop now if no more element expected */
01670           if (element_req == NULL)
01671             break;
01672           /* No datum can be end of field (unless quoted) */
01673           if (match_Mbuf (mbuf, FIELD_END))
01674             {
01675               if (element_req->kleene_starred)
01676                 break;
01677               else
01678                 {
01679                   Ferror (fptr,
01680                           "%s->%s->%s[%i]:\n  Element of type '%s' missing.",
01681                           entry->section->name, entry->name,
01682                           field->decl->name, element_index,
01683                           element_req->desc);}
01684             }
01685 
01686           /* Build the element for the field */
01687           build_element (field, element_req, element_index, fptr, mbuf);
01688           /* Goto next element */
01689           element_index++;
01690         }
01691 
01692       /* Expect end of field marker here */
01693       if (!match_Mbuf (mbuf, FIELD_END))
01694         {
01695           if (field_decl->kleene_starred_req == NULL)
01696             {
01697               Ferror (fptr,
01698                       "Expecting end of field marker '%s' for field '%s'.\n"
01699                       "Only %i elements expected for this field.",
01700                       FIELD_END, field_name,
01701                       field_decl->max_require_index + 1);}
01702           else
01703             {
01704               Ferror (fptr,
01705                       "Expecting end of field marker '%s' for field '%s'.\n"
01706                       "The number of elements required for this field is %i "
01707                       "or more.",
01708                       FIELD_END, field_name, field_decl->max_require_index);}
01709         }
01710 
01711       /* Free malloced field name */
01712       free (field_name);
01713     }
01714 
01715   /* Get the terminator at the end of the entry */
01716   Fget_token (fptr, mbuf);
01717   if (!match_Mbuf (mbuf, TERMINATOR))
01718     {
01719       Ferror (fptr,
01720               "Expecting '%s%s' at end of the entry '%s'.",
01721               ENTRY_END, TERMINATOR, entry_name);}
01722 
01723   /* Free malloced name buffers */
01724   free (entry_name);
01725   free (stripped_entry_name);
01726 }
01727 
01728 
01729 /* Checks for links that have become ambiguous after the entire database
01730  * has been built (Most will be caught while building the database).
01731  *
01732  * Returns the number of ambiguous links found.
01733  */
01734 int
01735 check_md_for_ambiguous_links (FILE * out, MD * md)
01736 {
01737   MD_Section *section, **link_array;
01738   MD_Entry *entry, *target, *link;
01739   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl, **field_decl_array;
01740   MD_Field *field, **field_array;
01741   MD_Element_Req *element_req, **require_array, *kleene_starred_req;
01742   MD_Element *element, **element_array;
01743   char *link_name;
01744   int field_index, max_field_index, max_require_index;
01745   int element_index, max_element_index, link_array_size;
01746   int error_count, i;
01747   /* Initialize error count */
01748   error_count = 0;
01749   /* Scan every section in md */
01750   for (section = MD_first_section (md); section != NULL;
01751        section = MD_next_section (section))
01752     {
01753       /* Get values into local variables for ease of use */
01754       field_decl_array = section->field_decl;
01755       max_field_index = section->max_field_index;
01756       /* Scan every entry in this section */
01757       for (entry = MD_first_entry (section); entry != NULL;
01758            entry = MD_next_entry (entry))
01759         {
01760           /* Get values into local variables for ease of use */
01761           field_array = entry->field;
01762           /* Scan every field for multi-target links */
01763           for (field_index = 0; field_index <= max_field_index; field_index++)
01764             {
01765               /* Get the field for this index */
01766               field = field_array[field_index];
01767               /* Skip undefined fields */
01768               if (field == NULL)
01769                 continue;
01770               /* Get the declaration for this field */
01771               field_decl = field_decl_array[field_index];
01772               /* Get values into local variables for ease of use */
01773               require_array = field_decl->require;
01774               max_require_index = field_decl->max_require_index;
01775               kleene_starred_req = field_decl->kleene_starred_req;
01776               element_array = field->element;
01777               max_element_index = field->max_element_index;
01778               /* Scan every element in this field */
01779               for (element_index = 0; element_index <= max_element_index;
01780                    element_index++)
01781                 {
01782                   /* Get element being checked */
01783                   element = element_array[element_index];
01784                   /* Skip NULL elements */
01785                   if (element == NULL)
01786                     continue;
01787                   /* If index in require bounds, get requirement from
01788                    * array.
01789                    */
01790                   if (element_index <= max_require_index)
01791                     element_req = require_array[element_index];
01792                   /* Otherwise get the kleene starred requirement
01793                    * (may be NULL)
01794                    */
01795                   else
01796                     element_req = kleene_starred_req;
01797                   /* Sanity check, element_req should not be NULL */
01798                   if (element_req == NULL)
01799                     {
01800                       L_punt
01801                         ("check_md_for_ambiguous_links: algorithm error, "
01802                          "element_req == NULL");
01803                     }
01804 
01805                   /* Skip all elements except multi-target links */
01806                   if ((element_req->type != MD_LINK) ||
01807                       (element_req->link_array_size == 1))
01808                     continue;
01809                   link_array = element_req->link;
01810                   link_array_size = element_req->link_array_size;
01811                   link = element->value.l;
01812                   link_name = link->name;
01813                   for (i = 0; i < link_array_size; i++)
01814                     {
01815                       target = MD_find_entry (link_array[i], link_name);
01816                       if ((target != NULL) && (target != link))
01817                         {
01818                           error_count++;
01819                           fprintf (out,
01820                                    "\n%s->%s->%s[%i]: Link ambiguous after "
01821                                    "entire md read in.\n'%s' could refer to "
01822                                    "'%s->%s' or '%s->%s'.\n",
01823                                    section->name, target->name,
01824                                    field_decl->name, element_index,
01825                                    link->name, link->section->name,
01826                                    link->name, target->section->name,
01827                                    target->name);}
01828                     }
01829                 }
01830             }
01831         }
01832 
01833     }
01834 
01835   return (error_count);
01836 }
01837 
01838 void
01839 L_punt (char *fmt, ...)
01840 {
01841   va_list args;
01842   fprintf (stderr, "Fatal error:\n    ");
01843   va_start (args, fmt);
01844   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, args);
01845   va_end (args);
01846   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
01847   exit (-1);
01848 }
